answers.answer: Just wanted to wish you the best again, and let you know you can feel free to message me anytime.

question: Hello,I have been off work for several months, had two spinal surgeries and am left with severe pain in neck, back, arms, and legs.  I have submitted a phone application for ssdi on thursday and supplied with a phone interview for tomorrow, tuesday.My question is, what type of questions they ask?  Is it really this easy to get an appointment?  What is the interview for?  Is it to determine eligibility?  How do I respond and what type of questions will they be asking? I am so nervouse.  I don't know what to expect.  I am relatively young, 43 and have been employeed several years by the state of AZ is that going to make adifference that I am educated and can find other work?  Although I don't know what I can do that is much different than what I already do.  I am able to get up when I need to and sit down when I need to.  Although the hours of computer work, court appearances and dealing face to face with families is nerve racking for me and I am unable to move around quickly to get out of posible dangerous situations.  I am unable to work sitting up.  I do pretty well while laying flat and adjusting every few minutes.  but going to work all day is impossible.  I cry consantly and I am still on narcotic pain medications.  Soma, Norco, and Cymbalta and Metformin for Type II diabetes and Sleep apnea machine for sleeping.  Does this all play a part?  Being only 43 what are my chances and what type of time lines am I looking at?
title: SSDI 1st interview
